answers.answer: Hi, Losartan is used for treating hypertension and in treating people with type 2 diabetes and hypertensive patients with kidney disease. This has a protective effect in preventing nephropathy. So, its unlikely to cause increased glucose levels. Regards.

question: I am experiencing much higher glucose levels since starting 50 mg Losartan Potassium in January.   Anyone else with similar experience?This was done as my echo showed elevated pulmonary artery pressure secondary to my heart conditions (post MI, with both diastolic and systolic dysfunction).
title: Losartan & Glucose
